XXXI. CHARTER by KING JAMES THE SECOND, under his Great Seni, whereby he granted to the Burgesses and Community of the Burgh the follow- ing privileges, viz. (1), that they should in all time thereaster be free from payment of the oustom of salt, and of the skins of sehorlings, skaldings, footfells, lentrinwai-e, lamb skins, tod skins, calf skins, cunning skins, otter skins, and fumart skins, and (2) that they might sell or exchange as well to strangers and unfreemen as to others, as well within the kingdom as without, the foresaid wares oi salt and skins without any custom being paid by the buyors, except the small eustom in use to be paid by strangors and unsreemen to the Burgh.

Dated at Stirling 9th November, in the fifteenth year of the King's reign [1451] . . . . Original Charter in the Archives of the City.
